loan.name: Crispy

texts.en:
Crispy is a 31-year-old, married woman with three children.

Crispy earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for five years, and she earns additional income from food vending. Crispy is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business.

Crispy is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: To purchase additional piglets, feed and vitamins for her business

loan.name: Ederlina

texts.en:
Ederlina is a 41-year-old, married woman with four children.

Ederlina earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She has been raising livestock for 16 years, and she earns additional income from selling ready-to-wear clothing. Ederlina is seeking to borrow a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: To buy additional feed and vitamins for her livestock

loan.name: Roger

texts.en:
Rice farming is the primary source of income where Roger and his family live. Roger is a simple farmer with four children who lives in Roma Norte, Enrile Cagayan. Being engaged in this business for almost 20 years has made Roger an expert in this field of work. But Roger still aspires to improve his farming practices. He is the asking for a loan of Php 20,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farm use.
Roger is 49 years old, married and he aspires for abundant harvest that will give him adequate funds for the education of his children. Roger also hopes to rescue his family from poverty.

loan.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for farm use

loan.name: Toth

texts.en:
Mrs. Toth is 47 years old. Mrs. Toth has six single children, all of whom live with her in the Siem Reap province of Cambodia. Two of her children are chefs, working for a hotel in the province; every day they go to work by using a motor-taxi service, which causes them to spend a great deal on transportation fees to and from work. In the picture she is making baskets by joining strips of bamboo together. She learned these skills from her grandparents, who were successful basket weavers in prior years. Besides making baskets herself, she also buys them from other local weavers and then resells them to her frequent and regular customers. She said that many of her products are sold in the markets, especially to foreigners visiting Cambodia. She is able to earn approximately $5.00 per day from this business.

Mrs. Toth wants to reduce some of her business expenses and to buy a second-hand motorcycle for her two children that travel to work. Thus, she is seeking her first loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a second-hand motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to own a store where she can sell her products.

loan.use: to buy a second-hand motorcycle so that her children can save money traveling to and from work

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 46 years old and married with four children. She has run a sari-sari store for nine years and also earns an income from pig fattening. Josephine works hard to provide for her family.

Josephine has requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF. She has borrowed and paid off twelve loans from NWTF before this one. She will use her loan to buy more items to sell in her sari sari shop.

Josephine aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari sari shop.

loan.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a hardworking entrepreneur who for the past nine years has had a furniture-making business in the Philippines. She also earns more income as a food vendor.

Judith has been sustaining her business through her own effort and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.

Judith dreams of repairing and renovating her family home and expanding her business.

loan.use: to purchase additional materials for her furniture-making business.

loan.name: Laddie

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Laddie works hard to support her family. She buys and sells vegetables in Bais in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

Laddie has been sustaining her business with the help of her past fifteen loans from NWTF. She is now borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

Laddie hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to renovate her family home.

loan.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables to sell.

loan.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 59 years old and married with eight children.
Lorna works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store.
Lorna has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for eight years and also earns an income from food vending.
Lorna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loan.use: buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. in her sari-sari store

loan.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is married with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Marites is 38 years old and has four children who are in school.
Marites has a business buying and selling bananas in the Philippines. Marites requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more bananas to sell.
Marites has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Marites would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loan.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and married with two children.
Vilma works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.
Vilma has borrowed and paid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for five years and also earns an income from pig fattening.
Vilma aspires to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: To buy more inventory to sell in her sari-sari store.

loan.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is married, and she is 37 years old. She has three children, and they live in Tabuan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines.
Nora operates a fishing business, selling seafood products including crabs and shrimp in the local community to earn a living. She's been in this business for five years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this type of business.
She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase additional fish to sell. Nora has been a member of GDMPC for a year. In the future, Nora wants to save money as a reserve for future emergencies.

loan.use: to purchase additional fish to sell

loan.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is 27 years old and married with four children. The oldest child is seven years old. Milagross husband is a fisherman.
Milagros provides manicure and pedicure services to the people in her community. She also sells fish at the market. Milagros said she is able to help buy her familys daily needs through these jobs. She requested a loan to buy nail polish, a cuticle remover, and an icebox for selling fish.
Milagros hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loan.use: to buy nail polish, a cuticle remover, and an icebox for selling fish

loan.name: Procora

texts.en:
Procora is 46 years old and is a married woman with 6 children. Her husband works as a fisherman.
Procora is a fish vendor. She rents a small space at the market to sell fish. Procora has had this business for more than 5 years. She requested a loan to buy fishing materials and an ice box for selling fish. Procora hopes to have a stable income that would enable her to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy fishing materials and an ice box for selling fish

loan.name: Magdalina

texts.en:
Magdalina is a 44-year-old married woman with 4 children who is separated from her husband. She's from Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Magdalina operates a gardening business to earn her living. She's been in this work for 13 years and she earns 8,000 PHP a month.
In 2010, Magdalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This will be the third loan taken out by Magdalina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loan.name: Rudelyn

texts.en:
Rudelyn is a 31-year-old single woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has a 6-year-old child.
Rudelyn buys and sells fresh fish. She rents a stall at the market to sell fish. She also sells dried sea cucumbers. Rudelyn requested this loan to buy an icebox and more fish to sell. Rudelyn hopes that her business will grow. She also hopes to save for her childs education.

loan.use: to buy an icebox and more fish to sell

loan.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio is 22 years old and has been a fisherman for 6 years. He lives in Trinidad, Bohol with his family.
Antonio is asking for a loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials. This will help Antonio catch more fish to sell. Antonio works hard to provide for his family. He hopes to send all his children to school.

loan.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and other materials

loan.name: Hilario

texts.en:
Hilario is peacefully living with his wife and three children. He is 45-years of age and runs his two hectares of rice fields. He has been managing it for almost 20 years and he really enjoys his farming activities. He and his wife work hard to earn a living. Hilario is thankful and blessed because his wife is supportive in managing their rice field.
Hilario's wife is involved in a direct selling business wherein she sells different kinds of RTW's, cosmetic products, lotion, perfumes and shoes. He really appreciates his wife's effort because she is helping him to make a living. According to Hilario, the income generated from his rice field's last crop have gone for the education of his three children.
In this situation, his income is no longer sufficient to improve his rice field. So, for this reason, Hilario decided to borrow for additional capital amounting to P30,000 which will be used in making his rice field more productive through purchasing the farm supplies needed in his rice production. He will be using his requested loan to buy farm inputs such as certified seeds, insecticides, herbicides, gasoline and to pay for the labor cost of planting and sowing the rice crop to his farm land. He is hoping that his patience and borrowed additional capital will give him a fruitful outcome. In this way, he could give his family a better living and send his children into higher level of education.

loan.use: to buy farm inputs such as certified seeds, insecticides, herbicides, gasoline and to pay for the labor cost of planting and sowing the rice crop to his farm land.

loan.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 30 years old and is a married woman with 5 children. The oldest child is 12 years old. Her husband works as a carpenter and seaweed gatherer.
Jessica has been engaged in seaweed farming for 5 years. She earns 10,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Jessica plans to use her loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs. Jessica hopes to have a stable income to support her family.

loan.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden pegs

loan.name: Maria Bona

texts.en:
Forty-year-old Maria Bona runs a small eatery in her town of Trinidad, Bohol. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a seaweed farmer. Maria Bona cooks delicious food that she sells to the people in her community. She also supports her husband in his seaweed farming.

Maria Bona has requested this loan of 12,000 PHP to buy ingredients such as meat, vegetables and spices. She also plans to buy straw line and wooden poles necessary for seaweed farming.

This loan will help Maria Bona continue her businesses.

loan.use: to buy meat, vegetables and spices for her eatery and seaweed farming materials.

loan.name: Nelfa

texts.en:
Nelfa is 22 years old and a married woman with three young children. Her husband is a fisherman. Nelfa and her husband started their fishing business three years ago. She sells her husbands catch at the market.

Nelfa has requested this loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fishing nets, hooks and buckets. This will help the couple to catch more fish to sell.

Nelfa hopes to be successful and send her children to college.

loan.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks and buckets.

loan.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is married with four children and lives in the Villaluz province of Isabela. Jonathan is a very responsible father and husband to his family. Jonathan is engaged in the farming business where he plants corn and sells it in the future.
Jonathan is requesting a loan of P 35,000 to buy seed and fertilizer that he can use on his farm. He wishes that someday his business will expand to give his family a quality life.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loan.name: Melarda

texts.en:
Melarda is 37 years old and a married woman with four children. She is a seaweed farmer, a sari-sari store owner and also makes rice cakes and other delicacies to sell in her community. She works hard to support her family.

Melarda has applied for a 3,000 PHP loan to buy more items to sell in her shop such as sausages and canned goods. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as sausages and canned goods.

loan.name: Bienvinida

texts.en:
Bienvinida is 52 years old and is a married woman with 4 children. She is a farmer from Trinidad, Bohol. Bienvinida grows rice crops to sell. She also buys and sells vegetables.
Bienvinida has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. Bienvinida hopes to have an abundant harvest. She hopes to make improvements to their house.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loan.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 51 years old and married. She has 6 children. Julieta has had a sari-sari store business for 20 years. She sells items like canned goods, soy sauce and vinegar. Julieta earns 5000 PHP each month with her business.
She plans to use her loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, rice and noodles. Julieta hopes to have a stable income that would help sustain her childrens education.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, rice and noodles

loan.name: Rolando

texts.en:
Rolando is a man with courage and dedication for his work. Rolando, 42-years-old, is married with three grown children. He engages in the farm business where he plants a crops like corn. Their village is well known as an agriculture area.
Rolando is asking for a loan of P 35,000 to buy corn seed and fertilizer for his farm. Rolando hopes that someday he can see all his children finish their studies and also he can provide for the needs of his family.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loan.name: Amalyn

texts.en: Amalyn is married with 1 child. Amalyn is 30 years old and lives in Galingon, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. Amalyn sells electronic load to earn a living and had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP500 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP3000 to purchase cellular phone loads for her reloading business. Amalyn has been a member of PMPC this year 2011. In the future, Amalyn hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase cellular phone load for her reloading business

loan.name: Silvestra

texts.en:
58-year-old Silvestra earns a living through farming. She is married and has 2 children. Silvestra grows rice crops to sell. She also makes curtains that she sells to the people in her community. Silvestra works hard to support her family.
Silvestra has requested a loan to purchase fertilizers, and more cloth to make curtains. Silvestra hopes for her ventures to prosper.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizers, and more cloth to make curtains

loan.name: Sergio

texts.en:
Sergio is a widow with three children. Sergio is 56 years old and resides at Camanga, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur: Philippines. Sergio owns farm land, on which he plants, harvests and sells rice to earn a living. He has been 6 years in this business. Each month, he earns PHP6,200 doing this type of business.
Sergio requested a loan of PHP5,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. Sergio is been a member of GDMPC for almost a year. In the future, Sergio wants to improve the general living conditions of his family.

loan.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loan.name: Exito Con Cristo 1 & 2 Group

texts.en:
Maria is the coordinator of Exito Con Cristo 1 & 2. Her group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for its baseball players and sugar cane industries. Its main economic activities incluD. a free traD. zone, a cement factory and other businesses. This group is maD. up of ten micro-entrepreneurs, and they thank you for your support.

Maria makes her home in a simple structure with her two children and her long-term partner. After work she enjoys resting and working at home with her family.

Maria operates a Fantasia, which is a small store where clients can find products like cosmetics and other beauty products. She has been in business for almost five years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She is excited to be taking her ninth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business.

Maria plans to use this loan of 82,500 DOP to buy jeans, shirts, cosmetics and other miscellaneous products for her store. She will use the profits to invest in her business, especially in this Christmas season when having a good inventory is great for business. Her plan is to expand her December sales.

loan.use: to buy jeans, shirts, cosmetics and other miscellaneous products for her store.

loan.name: Alejandro

texts.en:
Alejandro is 27 years old and a married man with one child. He lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with his family.

Alejandro has been engaged in seaweed farming for two years. He also sells fish to add to his income.

Alejandro has requested this 4,000 PHP loan to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw and wooden poles necessary for seaweed farming. He hopes to buy a fishing boat and start his own fishing business in the future.

loan.use: to purchase seaweed seedlings, straw line and wooden poles.

loan.name: Mercidita

texts.en:
Mercidita is 38 years old and married with six children. She is from Tukuran, Zambaonga del Sur in the Philippines.

To make a living, Mercidita runs a general store, selling a variety of food and home products to the local community such as candies, cigarettes, shampoo, soaps and many other things. She has been in business for over five years and earns approximately 3,600 PHP a month.

In 2010 Mercidita joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.

Mercidita is so happy now, since she has doubled her income through her third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use any additional revenue generated to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loan.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loan.name: Roberto

texts.en:
Roberto is 44-years-old and married with two grown up children. Roberto is a very hardworking and kind person. He is engaged in the farming business where he plants corn seed. Aside from farming, his spouse has a little store in front of their house.
Roberto is asking for a loan of P 30,000 to buy fertilizer and corn seed for his farm. He hopes that someday his business will expand enough to have a quality of living condition.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loan.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 47 years old and is a married woman with six children. The oldest child is 20 years old. Candelaria's husband works as a farmer.
Candelaria has had a sari-sari store (general grocery) business for five years. She sells items like soft drinks, shampoo and other daily use products. Candelaria works hard to support her family and send her children to school.
Candelaria is asking for a loan of 4000 PHP to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods. Candelaria hopes to expand her store in the future.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks and canned goods

loan.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam, a 34-year-old married woman and the mother of three single children, lives in Pouk district, Siem Reap province. She is a hardworking farmer. She grows rice crops in the rainy season and raises some piglets as well as poultry in her yard. Besides those farming activities, she also sells fish in the local market. Sometimes Mrs. Sam cannot tend to all the businesses at the same time, but she has her three children who always help her with this work besides their classes. Through these businesses, Mrs. Sam is able to make a profit of $4.50 per day to cover her daily expenses. With the loan amount of $1,100, she will purchase additional stock of fish, piglets and poultry. She hopes to lift her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.

loan.use: to purchase additional stock of fish, piglets and poultry.

loan.name: Romulino

texts.en:
Romulino is from Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 47 years old and a widower. To make a living, Romulino owns and operates various business ventures, planting and harvesting fruits and vegetables for sale, including bananas.
Romulino has been in his business for over 2 years and earns about 22,920 PHP a month from these activities. He has requested a loan of 50,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.
In 2011, Romulino joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loan.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loan.name: Cheene

texts.en:
Cheene is 22 years old, married, and has two young children. She lives in the town of Trinidad, Bohol with her family.
Cheene and her husband run a fishing business. They are able to sustain their family through this business. She requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and buckets.
She hopes for their business to grow. Cheene also hopes to save for her children's education.

loan.use: to purchase fishing nets, hooks, and buckets.

loan.name: Prudencio

texts.en:
Born in the village of Villa Luz, in the province of Isabela, Prudencio lives with his wife and their four children.
Recognized by the people of his neighborhood as a serious man, Prudencio, a farmer, would like to expand his crop production so that it becomes a viable source of income. To do that, he needs a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy seeds and fertilizer.
The income from it will then help him to cope with the needs of his large family and give all of his children a higher education.
Prudencio is very grateful to everyone who can help him achieve his dreams with this loan.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loan.name: Modesto

texts.en:
Modesto was born in the village of Villa Luz, in Isabela province. He is a farmer. He is married and they have two children.
For the past 20 years, he has been living in the town of Ilagan and working in agriculture. He has a five parcel of land which was granted to him by his father. Currently, his lands have been cleared. He will use the funds from the loan to buy seeds to plant corn, and also to carry out the necessary work to prepare the soil.
He is the sole support of his household, since his wife is a housewife. He is a longstanding client, and he is very grateful to the institution for the support given to him so he can continue improving his quality of life.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer for his farm.

loan.name: Por

texts.en:
Mrs. Por is a 40-year-old married woman who has been residing in the Baray district of Kompong Cham province. She is a loving mother of four children, all of whom are attending the local public school.
Mrs. Por earns a living by raising some piglets in the back yard of her house, and generates approximately $2.00 a day. This income is barely enough to cover daily costs.
Anyway, she also gets an income from her husband, who transports firewood for sale through the commune and local markets. Mrs. Por would like to ask for some funds from Kiva through HKL to purchase a buffalo that can be used to haul a firewood trailer.
With the profits she and her husband earn, they will be able to save so they can rebuild their wooden house with a tiled roof.

loan.use: to purchase a buffalo that can be used to haul a firewood trailer.

loan.name: Ricardo

texts.en:
Ricardo is a 48-year-old married man living with his family.
He has been working in the agricultural field for the past 16 years. In 1998, he bought a plot of land where he started to plant crops like corn according to the season. With his requested loan of PHP 30,000 he will be able to purchase fertilizers and seeds in order to increase his business productivity. Therefore, his sales will increase and so will his income.
In the future, he plans to buy new land to expand his business for his family to have better living conditions.

loan.use: to buy seed and fertilizer to his farm.

loan.name: Exito En Cristo 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Eugenia is the coordinator of her group, Exito Con Cristo 3 & 4. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her parents. She is a young hardworking woman. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study and become a professional.
Eugenia is excited to be taking her fifth loan with Esperanza, after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for almost two years, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying jeans, shirts, shoes, etc.
She enjoys doing business and reinvests most of her profits because she wants to have a big store in the future.She joined this Esperanza association because she needed to start a business to get enough income to pay her school expenses.
Eugenias group is located in San Pedro D. Macoris, a city famous for baseball players and sugar cane industries. The main economic activities are the free trading zone, a cement factory, and others.
Eugenia is very excited to receive this loan and start selling.

loan.use: to buy clothing.

loan.name: Joena

texts.en:
43-year-old Joena is a married woman with 5 children. She has had a sari-sari store for 10 years, where she sells items like shampoo, soap, and bottled water to her community. She earns 5,000 PHP each month from her business, which she does her best to improve while supporting her family.
Joena is asking for a loan to buy more items to sell in her store such as canned goods, shampoo and gasoline. She hopes to expand her store in the future.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, shampoo and gasoline

loan.name: 070701-Thn 9-Hong Thnh Hoang Hoa Group

texts.en:
Dung is 49 years old. She is married and has three children. She is the leader of a three-member group, the 070701-Thn 9-Hong T.nh-Hong Ho solidarity group. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.
Dung works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Dung has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Dung faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
In 2008, Dung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Dung has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
In the future, Dung hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loan.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loan.name: Srauy

texts.en:
Srauy (in the photo) and her husband, Po are farmers. They grow papaya, eggplant and other vegetables on their farmland in the village where they live. In addition, Srauy is also a weaver. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Srauy is asking for a loan in the amount of $1,200 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm. She will also use a part of the loan to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loan.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her farm and buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loan.name: Tuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuya, 38, is a seamstress. She lives with her husband, and they have no children. For the past 3 years she has been running a sewing shop in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia, called Khatan Goo. Her shop already has many permanent customers and they all say that Tuya is a skillful and hard-working seamstress.
Lately there have been a great many orders coming in from her customers for national and casual clothes for the coming holiday, Tsagaan sar, which is a major, respectful, traditional Mongolian celebration. Mrs. Tuya needs a large amount of working capital to purchase textiles and draperies to fulfill the orders. Her loan will be dedicated to this purpose.

loan.use: to purchase textiles and draperies to fulfill her orders

loan.name: Abdumannon

texts.en: Abdumannon lives in the city of Istaravshan. He is 43 years old, married and has four children. His wife is involved in sales. Abdumannon is involved in manufacturing and selling oven pipes. His son helps him in this business. The goal of obtaining this loan is the purchase of raw materials for manufacturing.

loan.use: to purchase raw materials

loan.name: Vanna

texts.en:
Vanna (pictured with her loom) and her husband, Vuthy, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have four children: two sons and two daughters. Three of them are in school and the other one is still too young.
Vanna is a weaver, while her husband is a fisherman and does construction work.
She hopes to continue her weaving business because its a traditional profession, so she is asking for another loan of $400 to buy weaving materials.

loan.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business.

loan.name: 070501-Thn 7-Hong Thnh-Hong Ho Group

texts.en:
Ln is 28 years old. She is married and has one child. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 070501-Thn 7-Hong T.nh-Hong Ho solidarity group. She lives and works in the Hong Ha district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.
Ln works in agriculture, raising poultry andcattle. Ln has been involved in this business for three years. The main hardship that Ln faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
In 2010, Ln joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Ln has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
In the future, Ln hopes to buy land of her own, to maintain a successful business, and for her business to do well.

loan.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

loan.name: San

texts.en:
San (pictured with her loom) and her husband live in a small village across the Mekong River about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 2004 and have one son and one daughter. Both are still young.
San is a weaver and she is also a rice farmer. Her husband is a driver.
She is asking for another loan in the amount of $500 to continue her weaving business by buying weaving materials. She will also use a part of the loan to assist in her rice farming business by buying seed, fertilizer and pesticide.

loan.use: To purchase weaving materials for her weaving business and buy seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her rice farm.

loan.name: Sokkhim

texts.en:
Sokkhim is 30 years old and her husband, Sambath, is 32 years old. They live in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. The couple has been married since 2002 and has two children, one son and one daughter. All of them are in school.
Sokkhim sells steamed corn, while her husband is a construction worker. In addition, they are also rice farmers. Sokkhim is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to assist in her rice farming by purchasing a tractor.
Photo: Sokkhim is pictured. She looks like a man because she just shaved her hair.

loan.use: To buy a tractor for use on her farm.

loan.name: 070301-Thn 5-Hong Thnh-Hong Ho Group

texts.en:
Tnh is 58 years old. She is married and has four children. She lives and works in Hong Ha district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents. She is the leader of a six-member group.
Tnh works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle. Tnh has been involved in this business for six years. The main harship that Tnh faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.
In 2007, Tnh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tnh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
In the future, Tnh hopes to buy land of her own, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loan.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in future.

loan.name: Sokrin

texts.en:
Sokrin (pictured above) and her husband, Piseth, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1987 and have five children -- three sons and two daughters. Two have full-time employment and the other three are in school.
Sokrin is a weaver, while her husband is a security guard. She is asking for a loan of $600 to build a brick room under her house.

loan.use: To build a brick room under her house.

loan.name: Gerelmaa

texts.en:
Mrs. Gerelmaa is a 31 year-old clothes seller in a supermarket called Sunday, located in downtown Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her husband and her 3 children in a rental house. She has been selling clothes for 3 years and has thus gained some experience in her business. Currently her wages are the main source of income for her family. Therefore she always tries to increase her earnings by improving her business day by day.
Now Mrs. Gerelmaa needs some money to purchase winter clothes to sell for the upcoming season, because these clothes are more expensive than other seasonal clothes in Mongolia. This represents a significant opportunity to increase her income for the year.

loan.use: to purchase winter clothes to sell for the upcoming season

loan.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy (shown in the photo) is 34 years old, and her husband, Tha, is 41 years old. They have been married since 2000 and have three sons. One is in school and others are still young. The family lives in a village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.
Chanthy grows small mango trees and sells them from her home. Her husband is an auto repairman. He does not have his own shop, so he is hired for a fee. Chanthy is asking for her first loan in the amount of $500 buy a motorbike for commuting.

loan.use: to buy a motorbike for commuting.

loan.name: Gantsooj

texts.en:
Mr. Gantsooj, 20, is a taxi driver and he has been running his taxi since he got his driver's license. He lives with his wife in his parent's house. Initially, he started his taxi service with his dads car, but now he has own new car, bought with his earnings. Now he already has permanent customers for his taxi line.
Gantsooj always thinks about moving out from his parents house and living individually with his own family in a ger. But, he could not achieve this plan, due to some financial problems. A ger is the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent and it does not cost so much in the markets of Mongolia. It consists of its wall, made of sheep's wool and other parts made of wood. Historically, Mongolians have been living and using the ger for their nomadic life for many hundreds of years. The loan Gantsooj is taking will be used to cover the cost of a new ger for his family's housing.

loan.use: to cover the cost of a new ger for his individual life.

loan.name: Moonon

texts.en:
Mr. Moonon, 49, is retired and lives with his wife and 4 children in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. All of his children still live together with their parents. Moonon was an army man and has worked as a colonel of the Mongolian Military Force.
Moonon always wants his children to move out and start their individual lives immediately. His elder son, Ariunbold, will be married in next month, before the Christmas day. Therefore, his father Moonon wants to prepare his wedding gift, a ger. A ger is the nomadic Mongolian traditional tent and it does not cost so much in the markets of Mongolia. It consists of its wall, made by sheep's wool and other parts made of wood. Historically, Mongolians have been living and using the ger for their nomadic life for many hundreds of years. The loan Moonon is taking will be used to cover the cost of new ger for his sons wedding.

loan.use: to cover the cost of a new ger for his sons wedding.

loan.name: Narantuya

texts.en:
Mrs. Narantuya runs a retail business of beautification commodities such as a bandeaus and earrings, etc. She has been doing her business since 2003 and has gained a lot of experience in her business field. She lives with her husband and her younger son in a boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her business has been running for the last several years and she has bought a car with her earnings in the last year. Now this car is used as a taxi by her husbands business.
Now Narantuya needs some money to purchase more beautification commodities from her suppliers than before for her sales, due to coming the holidays. During New Year days and next traditional celebrations, there will be much more sales in the markets of Mongolia. It is a beneficial time of year and a big chance to increase her income. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to purchase a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loan.use: to purchase a large number of commodities for increasing her sales.

loan.name: Tohir

texts.en: Tohir is involved in transporting passengers in his passenger car. He has been in this business for three years. Tohir is 27 years old, married and has one child. He is requesting this loan in order to install equipment for natural gas.

loan.use: to install natural gas equipment

loan.name: Savun

texts.en:
Savun and her husband, Sophal, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1995 and have three children, two sons and one daughter. One is a weaver and the others attend school.
Savun is a weaver. In addition, she raises pigs at home. Her husband is a house builder. Savun hopes to continue her pig farming by buying additional pigs and feed. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to provide her with capital.
Photo: Savun and her loom.

loan.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loan.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Mr. Ganbat, 30, is a teacher of driving. He has been doing his job for many years. He lives with his family in the house which is located in the boundary district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His monthly salary does not meet with his family expenses and he always searches ways to raise his family income. His wife, Urangoo, has not been employed still and cares their children at home.
She and Ganbat havw a plan to start a grocery store business to increase their income. It is a beneficial way to raise his family income in the future. Urangoo will run their grocery store and will sell the food commodities according their plan. The loan he is taking will be used to purchase the food commodities for building the working capital of his new grocery store.

loan.use: to purchase the food commodities for building the working capital of his new grocery store.

loan.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for further improvement of her decorative embroidery business. With the loan, she will purchase beads, thread, and other materials in bulk to allow her to make even more beautiful embroidered clothes and earn more profits.
She is very skillful and receives a good number of orders every month. She is confident that a loan will help her to make her business more profitable. Her husband is also an embroidery expert. Both Farhat and her husband work very hard to put three meals on the table.
Farhat is the mother of two daughters; the elder one is six years old, and the younger is only one year old. With the loan investment, she hopes to earn more profits, allowing her to send her elder daughter to school.
Note: In the picture, the lady holding a passbook (called the Asasah passbook) is Farhat.

loan.use: to buy beads and thread for her embroidery business.

loan.name: Sinat

texts.en:
Sinat is a garment worker. Her husband, Ban, is a construction worker. They have been married for seven years and have no children.
Sinat is living with her parents in a village about seventeen kilometers south of Phnom Penh City. She now wants to live separately by building her own house, but she does not have the money to do so. Therefore, she is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000.
Photo: Sinat is pictured at her parents house.

loan.use: to build her own house.

loan.name: Lay

texts.en:
Mrs. Lay, 64, is in the business of raising pigs. She has been engaged in this business, from which she is able to yield an income of $2.00 per day, since 2004. She has a life partner in her husband, who earns a living by selling the firewood, using animals force to haul his firewood-trailer.
Presently, Mrs. Lay needs some funds in the sum of KHR3,800,000 from HKL and Kiva to purchase an additional buffalo to support her husbands business. This loan will help her familys living conditions improve. She wants to expand her pig-raising business in the future. Now she lives with 3 single children and her husband in Baray district.

loan.use: to purchase an additional buffalo to support her husbands business.

loan.name: Nachmuddin

texts.en: Nachmuddin is a resident of the city of Kulob. He is 33 years old, married and has two children. He has a secondary-specialized education. His profession is a driver. Nachmuddin has been working in his field for five years. Besides this work, he is involved in sales at the market. Nachmuddin sells children's clothing. He is requesting this loan to increase merchandise selection.

loan.use: to purchase warm children's clothing

loan.name: Lorna

texts.en: 44-year-old Lorna is a married woman with 5 children. Her oldest child is 24 years old. Lorna and her husband run a fishing business in Talibon, Bohol. Her husband operates their boat and she sells his catch in a small stall at the market. She plans to use her loan to purchase a fishing boat and nets. Lorna hopes to have a progressive business.

loan.use: to purchase a fishing boat and nets

loan.name: Rosana

texts.en:
Rosana is 46 years old, married, and has 10 children aged 2 to 27. She and her husband run a fishing business in Trinidad, Bohol. They have had this business for 19 years. Each month, they earn 9,000 PHP from fishing. She does her best to support their big family. She sells banana cues (deep fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar) and other kinds of delicacies to help augment their income.
Rosana has requested this loan to purchase fishing nets, baits and other materials. She hopes for their fishing business to grow, and to be able to send her children to school.

loan.use: to purchase fishing nets, baits and other materials

loan.name: Marta

texts.en:
Raising hogs keeps Marta busy with a schedule of cleaning and feeding the hogs three times a day. She decided to establish her business to generate income instead of just lazing at home and doing household chores. She is 46 years old and married with three children who attend school and need daily allowances.
She would like to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for the sustenance and proper growth of her hogs, but she has insufficient funds. Marta is asking for a loan of PHP 10,000. She wants to diversify her business in the future and hopes this loan will be granted as it is her only chance to improve her business and her family's lives as well.

loan.use: to buy vitamins, vaccines, and feed for her hogs.

loan.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 49 years old and a widow with two children. She lives in Calabayan, Ozamis City.
To make a living, Elsa operates a specialized retail business in the cloth and dressmaking sector. She has been engaged in this business for three years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.
In 2007, Elsa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elsa is requesting loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cloths to sell and supplies to used. This will be the third loan taken out by Elsa from GDMPC.
She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase additional cloths to sell and supplies to use

loan.name: Munawar's Group

texts.en:
Munawar is a 47-year-old married mother of two sons and a daughter. Her sons are young and do a variety of work to contribute to the family financially, while her daughter remains at home and helps Munawar in her daily routine tasks.

Munawar is a decorative embroidery expert whose passion and love for her work motivates her to create new and unique products which earn her steadily increasing orders every month. Her husband is an expert in furniture polishing. He is very hard worker who operates his business from a nearby market.

Munawar has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further expansion of her embroidery business. With the loan, she will buy embroidery material such as beads, threads, and embroidery frames in bulk quantities that will enable her to increase her profits by offering better quality work to her clients. Having operated her business for many years, this experienced entrepreneur is confident that the loan investment will be a productive one for her.

Note: In the picture, the lady holding the book called Asasah Passbook is Munawar.

loan.use: To buy threads, beads, and embroidery frames for her embroidery business.

loan.name: Inua B Group

texts.en:
Receive greetings from Inua B Group in Western Kenya! As with the majority of people in this part of Kenya, the members of Inua B Group are farmers, who rely on maize for food security and income. With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Phoebe and her group during Kenyas next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Funds integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.
Phoebe is the facilitator of the Inua B group. She is in the photograph with her group members above. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Inua B group will each plant between and 1 acre of maize.
Phoebe is the mother of two children. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Phoebe had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Phoebe was only able to harvest 3 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. With income from maize sales, Phoebe will ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.

loan.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loan.name: Bunafsha

texts.en: Bunafsha lives in the city of Khujand. She is 25 years old, married and has two children. She has a secondary-specialized education and is a seamstress. Bunafsha has been involved in sewing for 15 years. Besides this work, she opened an internet cafe at her home. Bunafsha has been in this business for four years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of computers.

loan.use: to purchase computers

loan.name: Armando

texts.en:
Armando is 52-years of age, married and has been blessed with five children. He is living in the village of Bugallon Norte, Ramon. He works hard to make a living. Armando is glad because his wife is helping him in improving the living conditions they have.
Armando has been involved in the hog raising business for four years. He is raising one sow and fattening seven hogs. He patiently runs his business though sometimes he has suffered from difficulties. He endured all those hardships in his hog raising business because he is aiming to give his family a better future and to improve their living conditions.
He is happy seeing that his wife is also busy in running her retail store. Armando would like to ask for financial assistance amounting to P35,000 which will be used to buy feeds for the daily maintenance of his hogs. He is hoping that he could get the amount requested because it will help him to fatten his hogs. This would mean a lot on him because he could raise them well until they will reach their optimum growth. In that way, he could sell them for a greater price and he could also save some for his security purposes when he gets weak.

loan.use: to purchase feeds for daily maintenance of raised hogs.

loan.name: Jovelyn

texts.en: Jovelyn is 27 years old and lives in Lupagan,Clarin,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 2 children. Jovelyn has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 3,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan to purchase a motorcycle. Jovelyn has been a member of PMPC for a year. In the future, Jovelyn hopes to send her children to college.

loan.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loan.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her business of making shoes. She operates her business with her 28-year-old son who collects orders from the market and then both he and Sughran then prepare shoes to fulfill those orders. With the loan investment, she will buy leather and shoe laces in a larger quantity which will allow her to complete the orders on time and increase her income.
She has 4 other children, 3 of them study while 1 works. Sughran is 56-years-old, but she is still very active and also manages her household tasks very well along with her business. She is a very efficient lady and has raised her children very well. She has a very good reputation in her community due to her good nature.
She is very experienced and has been operating her business for the past many years. She is confident that the loan investment will help her to increase her profits and she will be in position to allow her her eldest son to marry in the near future.
Note: "In the picture, the lady holding the passbook called Asasah Passbook is Sughran."

loan.use: to buy leather and shoe laces for shoe making business.

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 50 years old and lives in Libertad Alto,Sinacaban,Misamis Occidental. She is married with 3 children. Josephine has a shop that sells shampoo, canned goods, soap, toothpaste etc. She has had this business for 30 years. She requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to purchase additional products such as shampoo, canned goods, soap, toothpaste, etc. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for 6 years. In the future, Josephine hopes to save money for future emergencies.

loan.use: to purchase additional products such as shampoo, canned goods, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loan.name: Yekhaka Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Yekhaka Group in Western Kenya! Everlyne takes care of seven children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Everlyne had a very good maize yield harvesting 12 bags on 1/2 an acre of land. Before joining One Ace Fund, Everlyne was only able to harvest 3.5 bags of maize on 1/2 an acre of land. With income from maize sales, Everlyne will educate her children, ensure food security and invest in livestock rearing.
Everlyne is the facilitator of Yekhaka group. This group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. In 2012, the members of Yekhaka group will each plant between and 1 acre of maize.
With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Everlyne and her group during Kenyas next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Funds integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

loan.use: To source farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizer at low prices for the 2012 planting season

loan.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene is married with 2 children. Arlene is 40 years old and lives in San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. Arlene owns a general store and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 5000 to purchase more stock for her general store. Arlene has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Arlene hopes to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock for her general store

location.town: San Miguel, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte

loan.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios has run her home-based store for almost ten years and she is able to earn about P2,000 monthly. She uses her generated income to pay for her daily household expenses and for electric bills. Though she is widower, still she is doing her best to earn a living. Remedios has been blessed with two children but they have settled into marriage and they separately live with their own families.
Remedios would like to increase the volume of stock merchandise in her home-based store because her travel expenses are costly so she would like to minimize her expenses in going to and from the market. With this in mind, she is asking for additional working capital in the amount of P15,000. This amount will give her greater profits because she will be using her requested loan amount wisely. Remedios believes that her patience will give her greater impact most especially in improving her store and living situation.

loan.use: to buy stock merchandise for her retail store.

loan.name: Rebelita

texts.en:
Rebelita is 49, married and has three school-age children. Due to financial difficulties, she helps her husband in managing their corn farming business for it is the main source of their income. Despite the hardships in farming, they are strong enough to face whatever challenges they encounter in life.
They aim to increase their yields and income to be able to support the education of their children and satisfy their basic necessities. In this regard, Rebelita is asking for an additional capital of P25,000 to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and to pay labor cost required in corn planting. They believed that through patience and hard work, they will have a fruitful harvest. They hope that in the future they will improve their status of living and give their children a better life.

loan.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost required in corn planting.

loan.name: Filomena Group

texts.en:
Filomena is 28 years old and lives in Kinangay Norte,Clarin, Mis. Occ. She is married with three children. Filomena has a general store business and earns approximately PHP 1,500 each month. She has requested a loan of PHP 3,000 to purchase canned goods, shampoo, noodles, etc. Filomena is a new member of PMPC. In the future, Filopmena hopes to be successful in her chosen business.
Filomina is the leader of a four-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has her own business.

loan.use: To purchase additional stock for their business

loan.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is 56 years old and widowed with 4 children.
Elisa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.
Elisa has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 3 years and also earns an income from fishing.
Elisa aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loan.use: To purchase additional stock to sell

loan.name: Malikamo

texts.en: Malikamo lives in the city of Kulob. She is 49 years old, married and has two children. She has a secondary education. Malikamo has a retail outlet at the market, where she sells children's clothing. She has been in this business for ten years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of seasonal merchandise.

loan.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loan.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an internet cafe business in the Philippines.
She is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy an additional unit for her internet cafe business.
Anita has been in this business for 4 years. Anita earns additional income from her variety store and food vending.
Anita has been sustaining her business activities through her efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loan.use: to buy an additional unit for her internet cafe business

loan.name: Yorn

texts.en:
Yorn (pictured with her loom), age 38, is a widow without children. She lives with her mother on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Yorn has been a weaver for 20 years. She hopes to continue her weaving business because its a traditional business profession. So, she is asking for another loan in the amount of $600 to buy weaving materials.

loan.use: to buy weaving materials for her weaving business.

loan.name: Lei

texts.en:
Lei, age 40, is married and has four children. One of her children is working at a rice field. To earn a living, she has been farming a rice field for 20 years in a rural area of Ponhea Krek district. She also plants cassava to generate additional income. She can earn approximately two dollars per day to feed her family.
This is her first loan with VisionFund. She will use this loan to buy cassava trees and pay for laborers for her plantation. With this loan, she hopes to grow more cassava and earn more income for her family.

loan.use: to buy cassava trees for planting

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loan.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela works hard to support her family. Carmela is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines.
Carmela requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy fabrics and other tools for sewing.
Carmela has been in this business for 5 years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.
Carmela would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loan.use: to buy fabric and other tools for sewing

loan.name: Marcia

texts.en:
As a married parent of 5 children, Marcia works hard to support her family.
She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling dried fish. Marcia is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy more canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her general store business.
Marcia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loan.use: to buy more canned goods, soft drinks and other groceries to sell in her store

loan.name: Nerissa

texts.en:
Nerissa is married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Nerissa is 32 years old and has 1 child in school.
Nerissa has a Barber Shop in the Philippines. Nerissa requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy tools and equipment for her barber shop.
Nerissa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Nerissa would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy tools and equipment for her barber shop

loan.name: Mario

texts.en:
Mario had been a farmer for almost 20 years. He plants and cultivates rice as the primary source of his income. He usually earns about 20,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each harvest season, during the months of April and November. He has five children that attend school so he needs to increase his earnings. He wants to finance their education so that they can earn a degree, unlike him that only finished his secondary education.
He is now asking for a loan of 12,000 PHP to buy five bags of UREA (fertilizers) to be used for farming.
He hopes to increase his yield for a higher income and to improve his family's living conditions.

loan.use: to buy five bags of UREA (fertilizers) to be used for farming.

loan.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 64 years old and married with 10 children.
Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more soft drinks, snack foods and other groceries to sell.
Patricia has borrowed and paid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 6 years and also earns an income from selling firewood.
Patricia aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loan.use: to buy soft drinks, snack food and other groceries to sell

loan.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Sopheap (in the photo) and her husband, Sophal, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 1990 and have two sons who are attending school.
Sopheap and her husband are fish sellers and also raise pigs at home. Sopheap asked for a Kiva loan to buy feed for her pigs and sold the pigs once they were fully grown. She used the money from selling the pigs to continue her pig farming by buying new circle pigs to raise.
She hopes to apply for another loan in order to continue her pig farming by buying feed for her new circle pig farming.

loan.use: to buy feed her pigs.

loan.name: Edison

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Edison planned to expand his corn farming business to increase his yields and income to support his family's needs. He is a farmer who has four school-age children. He wants to continue sending them to school to earn a degree and become professionals someday. Although farming is a difficult business to manage, but through patience and sacrifices he can able to earn enough and support his family.
To work out his plan, Edison is asking for additional capital of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay for the labor cost required in planting corn. He is hoping that this loan will help him to increase his yields this coming harvest season and believes that his patience and hard work will bear good fruit someday.

loan.use: to buy corn seeds, fertilizers, insecticides and pay for the labor cost required in planting corn.

loan.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia works hard to support her family. Emelia is married and has a business selling curtains in the Philippines.
Emelia requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of curtain to sell.
Emelia has been in this business for 18 years.
In the future, Emelia would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loan.use: to buy more stock of curtain to sell

loan.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine is 43 years old and lives in Kinangay Sur, Clarin,Misamis Occidental . She is married with 9 children. Josephine has a shop that sells canned goods, noodles, biscuits etc.. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan of 5000 to purchase additional canned goods, noodles, biscuits, etc.. Josephine has been a member of PMPC for a month. In the future, Josephine hopes to send her children to college.

loan.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, biscuits, etc.

loan.name: Chum

texts.en: Mrs. Chum is 44 years old. She is a single woman who has been residing with her older brother in Baray district. She is a rice cultivator as well as a hog-raiser for some time, generating an income in average of $1.5 per day. Her brother also helps to support her by transporting firewood for sale, but currently his wooden trailer is broken down. Mrs. Chum has applied for a loan from HKL to purchase a new trailer to support her brothers business. In the future, Mrs. Chum intends to open a general store next to her house to sell mixed products for the people around her community.

loan.use: to purchase a new trailer to support her brothers business.

loan.name: Karagyz's Group

texts.en:
Karagyz is the leader of this group. She is 60 and married to a retiree. With her husband this brave woman has raised ten children. Two younger sons live with their parents and help them with housework. Thirteen years ago, with an initial investment of 10000 soms, Karagyz started to sell potatoes and apples. With the profits gained from the trade Karagyz was able to save money to purchase a vehicle for his son. Some profits she invests in livestock breeding. Reselling livestock after fattening she earns an additional 3000 soms per month. With money received from this loan she wants to purchase two sheep for breeding, fattening and resale. In the near future she plans to start repairing their house.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: to purchase two sheep for breeding

loan.name: Van

texts.en:
Van (in the photo) and her husband live in a village outside of Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They have been married since 1979 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The son is married and lives outside the family home and the daughter is a garment worker.
Van and her husband operate a business renting a space of their house to garment factory workers. Van is in the business of building two more rooms to rent, but lacks some money to pay for building fees, hence she is asking for her first loan of $500. She will use the loan to pay for her house building fees.

loan.use: to pay for her house building fees.

loan.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 51 years old and married with 6 children. With 2 children in school, Elvira works very hard to provide for them.
Elvira runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her store.
Elvira has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soap and school supplies.
In the future Elvira would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

loan.name: Halim

texts.en: Halim lives in the region of Qumsangir. He's fifty-one years old, married and has four children. His wife takes care of their household, while three of their kids are away working in Russia. Halim has a teacher's degree, but has never worked as one. He's an animal breeder and works from home. He's asking for a loan in order to purchase some livestock.

loan.use: to purchase large cattle.

loan.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy (pictured here), age 28, is a fruit seller. Her husband, Veasna, age 28, is an electrical teacher. They live in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, across the Mekong River. They have been married since 2004 and have three children: two sons and one daughter. One is in school and the others are still young.
Sophy is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to use to teach driving. She will also use a part of the loan to buy additional fruits for sale.

loan.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to teach driving and buy additional fruits for sale.

loan.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 56 years old and married with two children.
Erlinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more snack foods, school supplies and other groceries.
Erlinda has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 5 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.
Erlinda aspires to build and expand her business to support the financial stability of her family.

loan.use: to purchase more snack food, school supplies and other groceries

loan.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 33 years old and aresident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Erwin, a driver. She is mother to her four children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
Antonia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy shampoo, cooking oil, or an egg. She earns a profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php 1000 in sales every day.
To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a Php 50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. Antonia dreams of being able to give all of her children a high quality education through her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week. She also draws strength and inspiration from studying the Word of God.
* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loan.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loan.name: Flordeliz

texts.en:
Flordeliz is married with 2 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Flordeliz is 33 years old and has 2 children who are in school.
Flordeliz has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Flordeliz requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fabrics and tools for her sewing machine.
Flordeliz has been in this business for 5 years. In the future, Flordeliz would like to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy additional fabrics and tools for her sewing machine

loan.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 25 years old and single
Jonalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.
Jonalyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 3 years and also earns an income from prepaid cellphone electronic loading.
Jonalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loan.use: to buy more items to sell

loan.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 45 years old and married with two children. She is from Catadman, Ozamis City.
To earn a living, Winnie owns and operates a business venture, making and selling banana cue (a banana sweet) in the local community. Winnie has been in her business for three years, and she earns 4,000 PHP a month. Winnie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase more bananas to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
Winnie joined GDMPC in 2011 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. This will be the first loan taken out by Winnie from GDMPC.

loan.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loan.name: Has

texts.en:
Has (in the photo) is 46 years old. Her husband, Seng, is 44 years old. They live in a village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have one daughter who is in school.
Has sells coffee and Chinese noodles with soup at home in her village. Her husband is assisting his wife in the business. Has is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 USD to put an addition on her house.

loan.use: to put an addition on her house.

loan.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 44 years old, married and blessed with two children. Her husband is a motorcab driver while Marcelina manages their sausage and dried fish vending business. She was loaned the amount of PHP 14,900.00 to purchase additional sausage and dried fish to sell.
Marcelina would like her business to become progressive so she will be able to sell and supply all over Mindanao.
Marcelina is a pioneering member of Paglaum MPC.

loan.use: To purchase additional sausage and dried fish to sell.

location.town: Minaog, Dipolog City, Zamboanga del Norte

loan.name: Ilolbi

texts.en: Ilolbi is involved in sales. She has a store at the market, where she primarily sells women's dresses and suits. Ilolbi has been involved in this business for three years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of warm sweaters.

loan.use: to purchase warm sweaters

loan.name: Elvira Group

texts.en:
Elvira is 46 years old and married with six children. She lives in the Philippines.
To earn a living, Elvira is a farmer who grows watermelons. She has been doing this for 6 months. She has requested a loan of 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her watermelon plantation.
Elvira has been a member of PMPC for 4 months. She is the leader of a 2 person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member has their own business.

loan.use: To purchase fertilizer for her watermelon plantation.

loan.name: Bora

texts.en:
Bora (in the photo) and his wife, Saroth, have been married since 1986 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One sells fish, three are in school and another one stays at home. The family lives in a village approximately twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
Bora and his wife sell fish and chicken. They buy fish and chicken from the Prek Pnao market and transport them to sell in the Phnom Penh market.
Bora is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a motorbike for his daughter who sells fish. She will use the motorbike to carry fish for sale because she is currently using a bicycle.

loan.use: To buy a motorbike for his daughter to carry fish for sale.

loan.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie is 30 years old and married with three children. She is from Panta-on, Ozamis City.
To make a living, Angelie owns and operates a banana production business. Angelie has been in her business for 5 years and she earn 4,000 PHP a month for her work.
In 2011, Angelie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Angelie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting. This will be Angelie's first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loan.use: to purchase pesticides and cover costs paid for banana planting

loan.name: Aishakul's Group

texts.en:
Aishakul is the leader of this group. She is 52 and, unfortunately, a widow. She has two children: a son and a daughter. Her son works in construction and her daughter goes to school. A year ago, Aishakul collected 500 kg of apples from her garden. She sold that harvest and gained a profit in the amount of 5000 KGS. Since that time, she has been selling apples and pears to support her livelihood. With money received from the loan, Aishakul wants to purchase 1.5 tons of apples to resell at a higher price to gain profit. In the future, she plans to expand her business and improve her familys living conditions.
--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loan.use: to purchase 1.5 tons of apples.

loan.name: Shirlita

texts.en: Shirlita is widowed with 2 children. Shirlita is 30 years old and lives in Pan-ay Diot, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. Shirlita earns PHP 5,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 30,000 to purchase additional products such as canned goods, soap, biscuits, candies and etc. Shirlita has been a member of PMPC for 2 years. In the future, Shirlita hopes to send her children to college.
